questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions:
a) Why is 21 February a memorable day in our national history?
b) Who is responsible to raise a storm of protest and how? Describe.
c) How did the Pakistani government try to prevent the protest?
d) What did the students of Dhaka University do against the declaration of outlạiving all sorts of public meetings and rallies?
e) How is Language Movement related to Independence Movement of Bángladesh?

sub_questions.explanation:
a. February 21 is a memorable day in our national history because on this day in 1952, the heroic son's of Bengal laid down their lives to establish Bangla as a state language of the undivided Pakistan. On this day, we pay tribute to the language martyrs because of their sacrifice for the rightful place of mother tongue.
b. The then Governor General of Pakistan, Mohammad Ali Zinnah, is responsible to raise a storm of protest. In a public meeting in Dhaka, he declared Urdu as the only state language of Pakistan, which disregarded the language rights of the Bangalee. Therefore, a mass protest started across the country.
c. The Pakistani government banned all sorts of public meetings and gatherings to stop the protest that began following Mohammad Ali Jinnah's declaration of Urdu as the only state language of Pakistan and continued non-stop.
d. Against the declaration of outlawing all sorts of public meeting and rallies, the students of Dhaka University brought out a peaceful protest procession on 21 February, defying the law.
e. The Language Movement of 1952 kindled the sparks of independence movement in East Pakistan by making the Bangalees aware of their rights. Thus, the Language Movement is related to the independence movement of Bangladesh.

Mothership. Neil A. Armstrong died on August 25, 2012.

sub_questions.explanation: Neil A. Armstrong, an American astronaunt, is considered the first human to walk on the moon. He completed his B.Sc. and M.Sc. from Purdue University and University of Southern California respectively. On July 16, 1969, he along with his team launched the mission to the moon. On July 20, 1969; Armstrong landed on the moon successfully. After exploring the moon surface Armstrong and his team started their return journey to the earth. Neil A. Armstrong passed away on August 25, 2012.

questions.uddipok:
Mother Teresa was moved by the sight of the sick and dying on the streets of Kolkata. She founded a home for the dying destitute and named it "Nirmal Hriday", meaning "Pure Heart". She and her fellow nuns gathered the dying people of the streets of Kolkata and brought them to this home. They were lovingly looked after and cared for. Since then men, women and children have been taken from the streets and carried to Nirmal Hriday. These unloved and uncared for people get an opportunity to die in an environment of kindness and love. In their last hours they get human and divine love, and can feel they are also children of God. Those who survive, the Missionaries of Charity try to find jobs for them or send them to homes where they can live happily for some more years in a caring environment. Regarding commitment to family, Mother Teresa said, "May be in our own family, we have somebody, who is feeling lonely, who is feeling sick, who is feeling worried, are we there? Are we willing to give until it hurts in order to be with our families, or do we put our interest first? We must remember that love begins at home and we must also remember that future of humanity passes through the family." Mother Teresa's work has been recognised thought the world and she has received a number of awards. These include the Pope John XXIII Peace Prize (1971), the Nehru Prize for Promotion of International Peace and Understanding (1972), the Balzan Prize (1978), the Nobel Peace Prize (1979) and the Bharat Ratna, (1980). Mother Teresa died at the age of 87, on 5 September 1997. The world salutes her for her love and compassion for humanity. She has taught us how to extend our hand towards those who need our love and support irrespective of creed, caste and religion. The picture of Mother Teresa, draped in a white and blue-bordered sari, with a wrinkled face, ever soft eyes and a saintly smile, lives on in our mind:

Question:
Mother Teresa is still alive in our (a)___ though she expired almost 16 years back. She spend her entire life for the (b)___ of the poor people. She has taught us that helping the needy is the greatest work that a man can do. She lived a very poor life (c)___ the poorest (d)___ all pleasure and comfort. She loved all people irrespective of caste, creed and religion. That's why she has become (e)___ to all people of the world.

Answer the following questions to write a paragraph on "A Book Fair You Have Recently Visited" in 200 words.
(a) What is a book fair? (b) What was the occasion of the fair? (c) Where was it held? (d) How was the environment of the fair? (e) What experience did you gather by visiting the fair?

sub_questions.explanation:
A Book Fair I have Recently Visited
A book fair is a kind of fair where different types of books are displayed for sale. Nowadays, it has become very popular in our country. Last month, I visited'a book fair. I went there with my elder brother. The fair was arranged on the occasion of 21 st 21^{\text {st }} 2 1 st February, the International Mother Language Day. It was held at the Bangla Academy premises. As it was my first visit to a book fair, I was really surprised when I entered the fair. There were hundreds of stalls at the fair. The environment was charming. The stalls were arranged systematically. There were information counters. There were also some stalls for taking snacks. I saw that all kinds of books such as fiction, drama, poetry, novel, biography, translation, children's literature, story books, etc. were available at the fair. I bought some books on science fiction and comics. After walking for a long time, we became tired. So, we entered a food stall and took some light food. Suddenly, I noticed a crowd in front of a stall. I went there and became surprised to see my favourite writer Abdul Hye Sikder. He was giving autographs. I also took an autograph. We also attended a short seminar at the fair in which some renowned personalities of our country delivered speeches on the importance of books in our life. After that, we left the fair, but I brought with me a lot of pleasant experiences.

questions.uddipok:
Read the beginning of a story. Add at least ten new sentences to complete the story. Give a suitable title to it.
One day a crow became very thirsty. He flew from place to place in search of water. But he found no water. He continued his search for water ……………

sub_questions.explanation:
A Thirsty Crow
One day, a crow became very thirsty. He flew from place to place in search of water. But he found no water. He continued his search for water. At last, he saw a jar. He peeped into the jar and saw that there was a little water at the bottom of the jar. He tried to drink water but his bill could not reach it. He tried again and again but in vain. He became very sad and hopeless. Suddenly, he saw some small pieces of stone near the jar. A good idea came into his head. He picked up the stones and dropped them into the jar one by one. As a result, the water came up to the brim. The crow then drank water from it to his heart's content and flew away with a joyful mind.

questions.uddipok: Suppose, you are Samin/Samia. Recently you have celebrated your 16th birthday party. You have a best friend named Habib/Habiba who has sent a nice gift for you on the occasion of your birthday. Now write a letter to your friend thanking him/her for sending the gift.

sub_questions.explanation:
Dear Habib/Habiba,

I hope you're doing well! I just wanted to take a moment to express my heartfelt thanks for the beautiful gift you sent me for my 16th birthday. It was such a wonderful surprise, and it truly made my day even more special. Your thoughtfulness means the world to me, and I feel so lucky to have you as my best friend.

The gift was perfect and exactly what I needed! I can’t wait to show it off and let everyone know how amazing my best friend is. Your kindness and generosity never cease to amaze me.

Thank you once again for making my birthday unforgettable. I’m so grateful to have you in my life, and I look forward to celebrating many more birthdays together.

With lots of love
Samin/Samia

questions.uddipok: Suppose, you are Samir/Samira, and your friend is Sumon/Sumona. English is an international language. It is very important for many reasons. Now, write a dialogue between you and your friend about the importance of learning English.

sub_questions.explanation:
Samir : Hello, Sumon! How're you?

Sumon : Hello, Samir! I'm fine. What about you?

Samir : I'm also fine. Sumon, one thing I don't understand. Why do we learn English in our schools and colleges?

Sumon : Well, English is the international medium of communication and it's necessary for everybody. We're learning English .because most of the books in higher level are written in English.

Samir : Well, but we're not able to communicate in English although we've been learning it for 10 − 12 10-12 10 − 12 years. What do you think is the reason?

Sumon : Yes, you're right. I think the problem is in our system of teaching. We're still following the traditional \& old system of learning. We must adopt new scientific techniques to get a command over this language.

Samir : How do I have good command over English?

Sumon : You may get yourself admitted into a reputed language learning centre.

Samir : Thank you, Sumon. Bye.

Sumon : Bye.
